isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES65-5 - REASSEMBLY - CASE AND GEARS

step1.para: Place the countershaft assembly into the case ( Figure 64).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Place Countershaft Assembly into Case

step1.para: Position the reverse idler gear and thrust washers in the case ( Figure 65).

figure.caption: Figure 65. Position Reverse Idler Gear and Thrust Washers in Case

step1.para: Install the idler shaft with the flat side facing the bearing cap.
Assemble the rear countershaft bearing cap, gasket and shims ( Figure 66).

figure.caption: Figure 66. Assemble Rear Countershaft Bearing Cap, Gasket and Shims

step1.para: Check countershaft end play. It must be set between .001 and .008 inch (.025 and .20mm). Adjustments can be made by re-shimming the rear bearing cap.
Lower the mainshaft assembly into the case ( Figure 67).

figure.caption: Figure 67. Lower Mainshaft Assembly into Case

step1.para: Lubricate the input shaft pocket bearing with Moly #2 lubricant ( Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Lubricate Input Shaft Pocket Bearing

step1.para:
Install the input shaft bearing cap and gasket ( Figure 69). Secure with bolts. Refer to the TORQUE CHART
.

figure.caption: Figure 69. Install Input Shaft Bearing Cap and Gasket

step1.para: Assemble the clutch housing and gasket to the case ( Figure 70).

figure.caption: Figure 70. Assemble Clutch Housing and Gasket to Case

step1.para: Install the rear bearing cap and gasket ( Figure 71).

figure.caption: Figure 71. Install Rear Bearing Cap and Gasket

step1.para:
Set transmission on a bench and lock transmission in two gears ( Figure 72). The 1st-reverse clutch collar can be shifted by hand. However, pry bars must be used to shift the 2nd-3rd or 4th-5th speed synchronizers into gear. Install the end fitting, washer and nut. Refer to the TORQUE CHART
.

figure.caption: Figure 72. Lock Transmission in Two Gears

step1.para: Stand the transmission upright to check the mainshaft end play ( Figure 73). Rotate the mainshaft to properly seat the bearings. Place a dial indicator on the output end of the shaft and lift the mainshaft with pry bars. End play must be between .003 and .008 inch (.08 and .20mm).

figure.caption: Figure 73. Stand Transmission Upright to Check Mainshaft End Play

step1.para: If mainshaft end play is not between .003 and .008 inch (.08 and .20mm) ( Figure 74), remove the front bearing cap. Remove the bearing cup and shim spacer. Measure shim spacer thickness with a micrometer. Install a thicker or thinner shim to bring end play within specification. Reassemble front bearing cap and recheck end play to be sure it meets specifications.

Set the transmission back into a horizontal position and place all clutch gears in neutral ( Figure 75). Install the shift housing and gasket. Secure them with bolts. Refer to the TORQUE CHART
.

figure.caption: Figure 75. Set Transmission Back into Horizontal Position
